Params: {2: 'Bianca', 3: 'It feels like... I had a really long dream...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She furrows her brow, grappling with the remnants of the dream—too intricate, too visceral. Death, fear, the icy grip of seawater, and...'}

{3: 'Nothingness. Like an eraser dragged across parchment, it bleeds the nightmare dry, leaching color from those "memories." Fragments thin, turn translucent, then dissolve entirely, replaced by...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mother', 3: 'Bianca, did you sleep well last night?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Mmm... I dreamt about the school field trip last night!', 4: '2'}
{3: "Shaking off the subtle feeling that something's not quite right, Bianca gushes about her pleasant dream to her family."}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'In the dream, I went to the seaside with my teachers and classmates from the Babylonia school! And we visited that cool place by the water called the Copperfield Aquarium!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'We saw a huge bionic whale! And all kinds of different marine creatures...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Father', 3: 'Hahaha, does our little Bianca have her heart set on visiting the aquarium? How about we all go together sometime?', 4: '3'}
{3: "The minute hand on the clock creeps toward seven—it's almost 7:35, but the school bus comes by at 7:30."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: "Oh, I'm going to be late—bye, Mom and Dad!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bianca rushes to the door and grabs the breakfast her mom hands her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'School Bus Driver', 3: 'Morning, Bianca! Just in the nick of time, as usual!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Morning, sir! In the nick of time... still?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The blurry 7:35 in her memory fades away as Bianca cheerfully greets the driver and steps onto the school bus.'}
{3: 'The blue-haired girl is already sitting in their usual spot, smiling as she greets Bianca.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Did you get your homework done last night?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The words hang in the air as blank test papers start to materialize in her mind, a pen scratching to fill in the empty spaces.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Oh! Of course I did. That last problem was a real pain, though; it took me ages to finish it...', 5: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Have you finished it? Did you use the method the teacher showed us yesterday?', 5: '2'}
{3: 'Sunlight streams through the car window, lighting up the two children deep in conversation, sitting side-by-side.'}
{3: 'At midday, harsh light seeps through the gaps between buildings.'}
{3: 'Clutching a Tantalum-193 affinity report, Bianca stands at the entrance to the Babylonia Science Council.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Staff Member', 3: 'Have you really thought this through? Are you absolutely sure you want to be modified into a Construct?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: 'The modification carries a risk of failure. And if successful, you will lose your human identity and cannot be transformed back into a human.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Babylonia needs to fight the Corrupted and reclaim Earth. I passed the affinity test. As a Construct, I can save more people.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The staff member silently gives the document a stamp, and Bianca walks into the Science Council, affinity report in hand.'}
{3: 'When she steps out of the building, she has already become a Construct.'}
{3: 'Under the midday sun, Chiko stands in the shadow of the Science Council entrance.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "I've been waiting for you forever. Why'd you go and apply for the Construct modification by yourself...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Chiko is speechless for a moment. After a brief silence, she finally speaks again.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'I just thought... I thought you could have picked a different path.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Your grades were stellar. You could've gone to the Science Council, or Star of Life...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'I want to do more for Babylonia, for this world.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Have you picked your preference yet? Which force do you want to join?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "I haven't decided yet... The elite squads are on the front lines, taking Earth back, but I've heard the Engineering and Purifying Forces have a lot of openings too...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "The Purifying Force... you don't like it there?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "It's not that I dislike it; I just don't think it's a good fit for you. An elite squad would be much better.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'What about you, Chiko? Do you want to join an elite squad?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "...I've just looked into it a little. Didn't you say you wanted to do more? An elite squad would be perfect for that.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Though I suppose they won't make decisions based only on our preferences anyway.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Anyway, I don't mind where I'm assigned. I just want to do my part for Babylonia...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The darkness of night slowly envelops the world.'}
{1: '1', 3: "Bianca walks out of the Purifying Force Captain's office—"}
{3: "<s>Bianca walks out of the Purifying Force Captain's office—</s>"}
{3: "Bianca walks out of the <color=#ff4e4eff>Engineering Force</color> Captain's office—"}
{3: "Bianca walks out of the <color=#ff4e4eff>Engineering Force</color> Captain's office—"}
{3: 'She gazes at the sign for "Engineering Force", a feeling of dissonance washing over her like the evening mist.'}
{3: "<s>Bianca walks out of the <color=#ff4e4eff>Engineering Force</color> Captain's office—</s>\\nBianca walks out of the <color=#ff4e4eff>Purifying Force</color> Captain's office—"}
{3: 'In the blink of an eye, the sign that reads "Engineering Force" flips to "Purifying Force".'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: "...Am I just tired? Why does it feel like something's off with my visual module...?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She presses her forehead, fiddles with her visual module, then pops open an umbrella.'}
{3: 'Having just wrapped up a mission, Chiko asks her to catch a movie after she finishes her report.'}
{3: 'In the movie theater, Chiko has already found their seats.'}
{3: 'There are two main characters, and the plot is straightforward—'}
{2: 'Delapoer', 3: 'How... do we get out of the Snowfields?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Bianca, do you remember when we first met?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Inside the meeting room, harsh white fluorescent lights flicker overhead.'}
{2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: "Is the light on the fritz? I'll have logistics come take a peek later... It's really no big deal, just a tiny glitch, nothing to get worked up about."}
{2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: "Let's kick things off with introductions, starting with... you."}
{3: 'The Construct marked as "Purifying Force Captain" impatiently taps the table twice with a finger in response.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: 'My name is Bianca, from... <s>the Snowfields</s> Babylonia...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "The name's Chiko. Chiko Kirishima, from Babylonia.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Delapoer', 3: "I'm Delapoer. My gig is network operations...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Norris', 3: 'Norris here. I was an assault specialist with the Task Force...', 4: '1'}
{3: "As each person in the faceless crowd introduces themselves, a subtle sense of unease keeps nagging at Bianca's M.I.N.D."}
{3: '...Did Chiko join the Purifying Force at the same time as her?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: "Alright, now that everyone's introduced themselves, we can call it a day.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: 'Have you all got the rules of the Purifying Force down?', 4: '1'}
{3: "The captain isn't fazed by the scattered response, just tapping the table to get everyone's attention."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: 'Remember the most crucial rule.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: 'Stay away from tropical fish, because...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Purifying Force Captain', 3: 'There are no tropical fish in the aquarium.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The voice reverberates, echoing almost instantly in her M.I.N.D.'}
{3: 'A deafening roar erupts as the transport aircraft thunders to the ground—'}
{3: 'The world is swallowed whole by the howling snowstorm.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "There's no way our squad would survive. Going out of your way to come here will only put yourself in danger.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "But you're still alive. Where are the others...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "I took them out. They'd all become Corrupted.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "There are too many Corrupted crawling around. What you're doing isn't smart at all.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Bianca doesn't respond, her focus entirely on treating Chiko's wounds with gel and bandages."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: '...Do you know the captain already fell?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "...So, then, do you know we're both being considered for the next Purifying Force Captain?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'So you saved me just to put me deeply in your debt, and then...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Save your strength. We still need to get out of here.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bianca makes a makeshift sled and drags Chiko along, inching her way out.'}
{3: 'Chiko lies on her back on the sled, her eyes stinging from the bright blue sky and the snow piled high on the treetops.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "Your own M.I.N.D. is on the brink, too, isn't it?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Yeah, but at least I'm not physically injured.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: '...Why would you stick your neck out like that to save me?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "I won't give up on anyone who still has a fighting chance.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "You've gone this far, not wanting power or privilege... so what do you want, exactly?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Right now? Honestly, I just want us both to make it out of here alive.', 4: '1'}
{3: "As if on cue, the clouds part and the sun breaks through. The thin mist beyond the forest silently dissipates as the logistics team's rescue vehicles come roaring in."}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Is there an aquarium on Babylonia? I've been meaning to ask...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Why is "stay away from tropical fish" the Purifying Force\'s last rule?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her visual modules burst into a kaleidoscope of brilliant colors.'}
{3: 'The transport aircraft roars, climbing into the clouds.'}
